lines.text: We agreed before we were married we weren't gonna have any children.
And before we were married we *didn't*.
[Before getting married, hitchhikers Mark and Joanna spend a night in a hotel together]
This is definitely against my principles.
Good. I wouldn't like to think that it happened all the time.
I had absolutely no intention of sleeping in hotels.
[Mark and Joanna see a bickering couple]
That's marriage for you.
That's marriage for *them*.
That's marriage - full stop.
Just wish that you'd stop sniping.
I haven't said a word!
Just because you use a silencer doesn't mean you're not a sniper.

[Joanna has returned from an affair]
Hello.
Hello.
Well?

[softly, on the verge of tears]
I'm back.
Enjoy yourself?

[nods]
Yes, thank you. But I *missed* you.
[Mark sarcastically rolls his eyes, not believing her]
I *did*.
Why?
Because he's so serious.
I thought you liked people who were serious.
But he's *so* serious.
Well, I'd better make some funny faces...

[softly]
You don't need to make funny faces.
[Mark gives no response]
Mark, I'm back!
You humiliate me. You humiliate me... and then you come back.

[nods tearfully]
That's right.
Thank God!
[he hugs her and they tearfully kiss]

[upset]
You just want me to become a beautiful memory, the sooner the better!
Who said anything about beautiful?
Shouldn't get too much sun the first day.
I don't burn. I've got asbestos skin.
Are you a virgin?
[Joanna seems shocked by the question]
Thought you were. Can always tell.
Congratulations.
I was two years at the University of Chicago.
Studying virgin detection?
It's really meant for photographing three-dimensional subjects.
I'm three dimensional, as a matter of fact.
Darling, what's French for 'Inspector, I don't believe a word you're saying and you're not gonna get a damn penny?'
'Oui, monsieur.'
If there's one thing I really despise, it's an indispensable woman.
[last lines]
Bitch.
Bastard.
[Joanna waves her hand suspiciously over her drink]
What are you doing?
Just trying to discover where the strings are attached.
What kind of people just sit like that without a word to say to each other?
Married people?

[after Howard knocks the luggage off the top of the car by driving into a low beam carport]
Daddy?
Yes, Ruthie?
Did you do that on purpose?
No, Ruthie, I didn't. No, I did not. No, Ruthie. No.

[referring to a pair of newlyweds seated in the back of a Rolls Royce]
They don't look very happy.
Why should they? They just got married.
Why is it whenever you give a woman everything she wants she gets so bloody-minded?

[Mark and Joanna's car is on fire]
Water!
Oh! But where?
Find some!
Here, here.
[she hands Mark a bottle of water]
[he pours the water on the engine]
Oh! It likes water!
Now, I warn you solemnly, Marcus, you're denying Joanna the right to be her own, paradoxical self!
Howard, you're the largest pocket of untapped natural gas known to man.
Do you know what marriage is?
Hmm, you tell me, and see if we're thinking of the same thing.
Marriage is when the woman tells the man to take off his pajamas... and it's because, she wants to send them to the laundry.
